ca.sandstorm.luminance.camera
Class Camera

java.lang.Object
  ca.sandstorm.luminance.camera.Camera

public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object

6DOF Camera class. View matrix is represented by eye, target, up vectors. eye is the position of the camera. target is the line of the sight of the eye. up is the vector used to define what up is in terms of the camera matrix. The class uses Quaternions to represent rotations.

Author:
halsafar

setViewPort

public void setViewPort(int x,
                        int y,
                        int w,
                        int h)
Sets the OpenGL view port. This is controlled by the camera so multiple viewports are easily possible.

Parameters:
gl - OpenGL context, local scope.
x - x pos of the screen
y - y pos of the screen
w - width of the screen
h - height of the screen

setPerspective

public void setPerspective(float fov,
                           float aspect,
                           float zNear,
                           float zFar)
Set the perspective matrix for opengl.

Parameters:
gl - OpenGL context, local scope.
fov - field of view for the projection
aspect - aspect ratio (example: 16:9 vs 4:3)
zNear - near clipping plane
zFar - far clipping plane

updateViewMatrix

public void updateViewMatrix(GL10 gl)
Update the view matrix. Use this to set the camera up before rendering objects.

Parameters:
gl - OpenGL context, local scope.

getCurrentProjection

public void getCurrentProjection(GL10 gl)
Record the current projection matrix state. Has the side effect of setting the current matrix state to GL_PROJECTION

Parameters:
gl - context

getWorldCoord

public Ray getWorldCoord(javax.vecmath.Vector2f touch)
Calculates the transform from screen coordinate system to world coordinate system coordinates for a specific point, given a camera position.

Parameters:
touch - Vec2 point of screen touch, the actual position on physical screen (ej: 160, 240)
cam - camera object with x,y,z of the camera and screenWidth and screenHeight of the device.
Returns:
Ray based on camera view and touch location in WCS. null if no collision found.
